repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/28484.
Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/28719.

Co-authored-by: Chris <crwebb85@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Gregory Anders <greg@gpanders.com>
Co-authored-by: Jake B <16889000+jakethedev@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Jonathan Raines <jonathan.s.raines@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Yi Ming <ofseed@foxmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Zane Dufour <zane@znd4.me>
Co-authored-by: zeertzjq <zeertzjq@outlook.com>

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
Vim's todo.txt). Meanwhile the Neovim priority system is defined by:
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@ In practice we haven't found a way to forecast more precisely than "next" and
 * Next feature-release (1.x.0)
 
 The forecasting problem might be solved with an explicit priority system (like
-Bram's todo.txt). Meanwhile the Neovim priority system is defined by:
+vim's todo.txt). Meanwhile the Neovim priority system is defined by:

comment_data.body: I don't see why we need to remove these. They are useful for explicitness ("positive confirmation"), and occupy 1 line each.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6886,8 +6886,6 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	   options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
 			global values for local options)
 	   localoptions same as "options"
-	   slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-	   unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

comment_data.body: We've removed all instances of one-liner descriptions of deprecated options in `options.txt` before. Unsure why these are special tbh.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6886,8 +6886,6 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	   options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
 			global values for local options)
 	   localoptions same as "options"
-	   slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-	   unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

comment_data.body:
These are special because 

1. they're flags on an option, they are not options. So their presence is helpful because they document behavior of the option.
2. they don't pollute the `:help` tags
3. they they're near-zero cost

Not a blocker anyway.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6886,8 +6886,6 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	   options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
 			global values for local options)
 	   localoptions same as "options"
-	   slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-	   unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

comment_data.body:
I still don't get it. If we *remove* a flag of an option they should not be mentioned in `options.txt`, but if we *deprecate* a flag they should be? This seems inconsistent.

I will revert the change in any case.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6886,8 +6886,6 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	   options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
 			global values for local options)
 	   localoptions same as "options"
-	   slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-	   unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

comment_data.body: Also hard disagree, deprecation texts like this are obnoxious and unhelpful and I hate it. Dunno if that's a technical reason enough, but 99/10 times my instinctive response to reading these is "Cool, this information is completely useless. Why are you telling me about it? I want my 5 seconds of time back."
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6886,8 +6886,6 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	   options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
 			global values for local options)
 	   localoptions same as "options"
-	   slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-	   unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

comment_data.body:
Alternatively we could just mention the "/" and `\n` in the option description? That would take approximately the same amount of space though.

Of course, normally these implementation details shouldn't matter, but for this option apparently it does matter.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6886,8 +6886,6 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	   options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
 			global values for local options)
 	   localoptions same as "options"
-	   slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-	   unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

comment_data.body: This is fine for now, let's evaluate it on a future PR
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6886,8 +6886,6 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	   options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
 			global values for local options)
 	   localoptions same as "options"
-	   slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-	   unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

@@ -9388,8 +9388,8 @@ return {
            options	options and mappings local to a window or buffer (not
         		global values for local options)
            localoptions same as "options"
-           slash	|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
-           unix		|deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.
+           slash       |deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "/" in filenames.
+           unix                |deprecated| Always enabled. Uses "\n" line endings.

comment_data.body:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/28720#pullrequestreview-2051491767:

```suggestion
---@return table<integer, { error?: lsp.ResponseError, result: any? }>? result Map of client_id:request_result.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -938,7 +938,7 @@ end
 ---@param params table? Parameters to send to the server
 ---@param timeout_ms integer? Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a result.
 ---                           (default: `1000`)
----@return table<integer, {err: lsp.ResponseError, result: any}>? result Map of client_id:request_result.
+---@return table<integer, {error: lsp.ResponseError, result: any}>? result Map of client_id:request_result.

comment_data.body: This change seems also needed for `vim.lsp.buf_request_all()` and the two `results` variables in `vim.lsp.buf.typehierarchy()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -938,7 +938,7 @@ end
 ---@param params table? Parameters to send to the server
 ---@param timeout_ms integer? Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a result.
 ---                           (default: `1000`)
----@return table<integer, {err: lsp.ResponseError, result: any}>? result Map of client_id:request_result.
+---@return table<integer, {error: lsp.ResponseError, result: any}>? result Map of client_id:request_result.
